info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 26 at 11:24AM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Schenectady, southeastern Fulton, southwestern Saratoga and southeastern Montgomery Counties through 1215 PM EDT... At 1123 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Amsterdam, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Saratoga Springs, Amsterdam, Glenville, Ballston Spa, Hagaman, Round Lake, Fort Johnson, Galway, Rotterdam Junction, Burnt Hills, Rock City Falls, Tribes Hill, North Ballston Spa, Pattersonville-Rotterdam Junction, Country Knolls, East Glenville, Malta, Charlton, Perth and Glen. This includes the following highways... Interstate 90 between exits 26 and 28. Interstate 890 near exit 1a. Interstate 87 between exits 11 and 13S. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
